values:
It has been three months and fifteen days since last this livejournal was updated. 

Updates are as follows:
- Classes are fine. Had to do a collage for Art. Haven't got grade back, but I'm just glad it was over. It got in the way of me programming or doing fun things which are both things I find myself required to do from time to time.
- Have a summer job lined up at my mother's work (INA in Arkansas) doing some development on the Internet involving C#, ASP.NET and some other stuff (or something). At least I shouldn't be doing much website work like I was going last time (at least as obviously).
- I recently played through the second season of Sam & Max (produced by Telltale Games) and it was at least as good as the first season, which is to say pretty awesome. Some of the puzzles seem impossible to me without looking at the guide, but I just may not be good at any sort of detective work.
- Still go to Judo.
- Have classes lined up for next semester. Mostly math and some management courses. Data Mining, too.
- Still have "I Dreamed a Dream" from Les Miserables stuck in my head after watching the Youtube video of Susan Boyle singing it. Pretty good.

It is now 2009. That is all. 

Any further updates in this post will only be the product questions in the comments.

Because I'm lazy.

If anything be,
Then certainly something be,
Except a bee, see?

It's fucking Halloween and I'm watching shows about horror movies and such on Bravo. I'm sure there are parties sometime tonight somewhere on campus but a) I don't feel like dressing up/down/left/right and b) I can see drunken idiots any time I want to. As for the scantily clad women that are likely to be about, they are just about as easy to see on this campus (though it is depressing that it isn't far more common). 

Anyway, updates of my life are as follows:
1) I'm pretty sure that my journal loses its feel as a journal by my listing of things that have happened rather than having them presented in over-emotional paragraph form.
2) A week ago I bought Dead Space and have been playing it rather consistently. I like it and the atmosphere it generates, but am annoyed by the asteroid thing in Chapter 4. That and a couple of the 'beat the game' trophies are the only things I have yet to get. I've already beaten the game twice. Mmm... Force Gun.
3) As far as I know I have good grades in all of my classes and have very few major assignments left to do.
4) I need to play more Disgaea 3 and actually beat 1 and 2. Sadly, that means a couple good hours of leveling to get my guys ready to beat Tyrant Overlord Baal (who is about lvl 4000 even on the lowest difficulty).
5) I need more money. While I have enough to eat, I have nowhere near enough to get the games I want: Fallout 3, Command and Conquer: Red Alert 3, LittleBigPlanet, and some other things I've probably forgotten.
6) I. Need. To. Write. More. ...this doesn't count.
7) Ubuntu 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex) is pretty snazzy. When I installed it I found out I only had like a quarter of a gig on there, which was easily removed for later.
8) Odd food combinations: crunchy peanut butter and cheese dip tacos. 

Also, October is the Nightmare Before Christmas soundtrack month. Only damned thing I listen to.

As of last night I have my second belt in Judo (Green). I have taken to doing more Aikido-ish rolls in that I don't stop and hit the ground, I just keep going to stand back up. It's fun, but the momentum kind of freaks you out for a bit.

Also, I have been playing a shitload of PS3 (mainly Disgaea 3). Spore has been good, but I'm not that interested in it in comparison now that I'm at the Space level. The ones before it were rather fun, but the last one seems a bit tedious.
Hah. I love Friendly Hostility. "Little Sister." http://www.friendlyhostility.com/d/20080908.html

Alright, it's now about time for an update on my life. Before I get started however I should note that this injection of information about my current state into the Interweb is only prompted by the fact that I had a wonderful dream last night.

The dream itself was very long and I can't remember much of it but the parts that I do remember split it into an early and short portion wherein I had no control and a later, longer portion wherein I was at the peak of lucidity. During the latter part I wandered and went, warping dreamstuff like it was molding clay (though there was disturbingly enough a couple second delay when I assume one part of my brain was forced to talk to another to get things to appear). It was during this time that I did the following: ran past a building of some six stories (seemingly) that was luminescent and magnificent (in equal parts reminiscent of some high-graphic current generation games) and was arrayed with an odd and intriguing variety of windows, encountered an Alice in Wonderland-esque door of some few inches which I enlarged through willpower alone (and proceeded to step through), and came upon a room that mirrored my dorm room but for the fact that its materials were of such an unearthly (and colorful) quality that I doubt I should ever come upon them or consciously use them. All in all, it was rather nice.

EDIT: I seemed to have recalled a bit about my whole family being at a table and topic of religion coming up. I assume that those atheistic portions of the family (the majority) either don't care or antagonistic. My mother's mother seems a little miffed and is saying that God finds a good place in life (or something like that). Someone mentions her attending a church on Chenal. Sounds implausible at least in regards to the location of the church (for she lives in Benton), but it is a dream. Anyway the scene was one I was not in control of. It quickly moved on.

Otherwise, things are as follows:

Of Work
From the dates 7/28/08 to 8/8/08, I worked at INA doing website change requests. Worked about 83.5 hours in total because my ride (whom I refuse to name for various reasons) was freaking insane and woke up before 7 o'clock. I should consequently be paid a good amount considering my fee was $10 an hour. You can do the math yourself, but I know I'm getting a PS3 (Metal Gear Solid 4 Bundle). Regardless of what people say about the game station, I prefer it to the XBox360; it's shinier.

Of Play
Throughout the course of the summer (but for a couple weeks near the beginning) I have continued to go to Judo. I need to join the society so I can do the belt test and get beyond a white belt. Even for only having done this a little more than a semester I'm already tired of the damned thing (the belt, not the sport); it's frayed and oddly coloured and I dislike it.

Of Life
On the date of 8/15/08, I plan on moving back into the dorms. Thankfuck (one word, like "hallelujah"). I'm tired of not having fast, uncapped internet and being away from Sam's and people with copies of Rockband (which I won't be buying). I want a more regimented day as it improves my creativity and gives me things to deviate from. It also gives me the opportunity to watch the videos of Judo at the Olympics which I'm largely unable to do otherwise. The only portion I've been able to watch thus far involved two women having their heads smashed together and being forced to be bandaged during the match. There was also a coach that was fatter than Al Demers. That was freaking weird, though entertaining.

Of Study
This Fall I will be taking 18 hours. This increase in hours is to let me take 15 during the Spring Semester (so I can take Calc II and not have to worry about much else). On Mondays and Wednesdays (Wed-Nes-Days is seriously how I remember to spell this damned thing) my classes are light (two, far apart). On Tuesdays and Thursdays they run from 8 o'clock to 2 o'clock with no o'clock in between to get anything to eat. This is why we have Sam's and some portable foodstuff. Anyway, the classes I will be taking are as follows:

Speech Communications
Psych and the Human Experience
Discrete Mathematics
Database Concepts
Computer Systems
Internet Technologies
For those who care I've passed Calculus I with a B. My GPA has consequently dropped to a 3.72.

Copy and Paste from the record of the dream I had last night:

-- Start --

Beginning:

Gymnasium with a number of other people. On the right is a machine that seems a battering ram suspended on a large array that one is supposed to shove forward to break something. Many people took test shots towards us while we sat away from them on the opposite wall. Of the shots the majority weren't straight and one went whizzing over my head. Someone asked if anyone had not tried both of them and someone volunteered me. I said I had a giant curve to the left but I don't recall actually pushing the thing. Next I moved over to the right and tried to use the other "sniper" machine. It had one machine in the back in front of which was suspended a large gun. Next to the gun, on the right when facing, was another seat for a person who called coordinates and helped aim the gun. One moment a black woman (who was the usual operator of the coordinator finder) was using it with a girl, but the woman moved away and suddenly there was a boy there who was directing the gun somewhere else.

Change:

Suddenly I think I've been thrown out of Uni or at least its dorms. I camp out on what seems to be the top of a building though it seems to connect quite easily to a rise in the road on one side. On top of what seems to be an air conditioning thing I rest a number of blocks but find it too small to sleep on. I move them down to the ceiling, but the material there is too scratchy to sleep on. I move them back up and discover a number of worn, weathered journals (composition notebooks) inside the units. I don't read them. Instead a black boy comes near and tells me that he and his friends (whom I have seen before and found intimidating) want to see me. I say no many times thinking that they would hurt the now homeless. I consider that I could have simply shacked up with my grandmother up the road. The small gang then runs after me and I am chased away.

Later:

I find myself in a shower in what I assume is my dorm room (it feels right). I see that suddenly a bit of the shower screen is pulled away by a hand. I lean over slightly, hiding the majority of my body and find a beautiful girl (blonde I think, cute, casually clothed or toweled (I can't recall)). She's noticeably surprised and goes on to say that she looked in my room (peeked under the covers in fact) but found nobody. She had been wondering where I was. She even went to far as to ask the disturbingly straight forward question of "Have you been sleeping outside or something?" She then says something about not feeling so sorry for yourself and saying that if I wanted to give it up there were other, more helpless people who could use it. We move to what seems to another's point of view (I think camera at the time).

The video changes between scenes of a person that reminds me of Jesse Eslick meeting up with what I think at the time are the dregs of society and scenes of me running away from the gang I mentioned earlier. I wonder what has happened to Jesse. I wonder how much the girl had seen and (I think) I wanted to tell her.

-- The End --

I'm apparently however old I was last year plus one.

Other updates may follow.

Notice that I am back in my dorm room. Now then, this covers my first full day back.
Notes on my day:

It all began around 9am when I got out of bed, took a shower, and then put clothes on. I had a bowl of cereal and then went to the lab where I spent from 10am to 1pm doing lab hours (while simultaneously doing nothing at all). I then had some lunch. I didn't feel like going back to my dorm so I just had a burger combo at the local cafe on campus. I then went to my first class of the day, Human Computer Interface. I had some european guy who handed out syllabuses and then told us that all we would really be doing is making GUI interfaces with Java (which I can already sort of do). I then did some time in the lab (class was short) and went to Information Systems Software, which is going to be an OS-heavy class. We'll cover what makes them up and look at a couple, including Unix (which will take the last four weeks of class). The teacher there was Xiaosui Xu (or something like that). He seemed alright, though possibly not confident in his english. The third class of the day (which was preempted  by more lab time) was ASP.NET, which we pretty much just learned how to connect to the live server in. That one will probably be more difficult than the other two. Anyway, now for the interesting stuff:

- I went back to the dorm and relaxed for a bit. Had dinner (1 chicken patty and some cereal).
- Messed around on AL (which was fun) and was generally relaxed. Played a little Magic (which seems to be what I often do lately).
- Hours passed.
- Eventually my roommates started on the drugs (which isn't all that surprising):

== They combined DMX (or whatever is similiarly named) with Pot and Alcohol. This was alright for a good hour or two, but once it kicked in, it really kicked in. Apparently Zeke thought it reminded him of Acid, which isn't all that surprising considered his considerable knowledge on the topic. Anyway he was tweaking with wide eyes and an even odder demeanor than normal. He often found himself repeating the same words over and over again or not recalling what  just happened (which is what I thoroughly expected). After a bit there was some general calming of down (by others, not me) and he was generally alright. All he did was drink his Ambrosia (Diamond [something] Tea).
== Anyway, I went and got out my flashlight (thanks nanny) and flashed it in his eyes. While many would not consider this a good idea, I found it hilarious. He wigged out, asked for it again, and then went into our other roommate's room (who was gone) and went digging for a floodlight (because I wasn't giving him anymore). I went back to my room and emerged some time later. He was plopped down in front of a video (which was trippy and awesome) and was generally content.
== I believe that by now someone has taken him somewhere else.

- Also, I have no idea why people are so horrified by the things that druggies do. If they end up killing themselves or going to jail, it's thoroughly their fault and I'll have no remorse (not in my apartment!).

Hmm... I did better than I thought I would (slightly):

Information Science Degree - Freshman

Final Grades for Fall Semester ('07)

(A) - 3 hrs - History of Civilization I
(A) - 1 hrs - Intro To Ethics
(A) - 3 hrs - Problem Solving Tech
(A) - 3 hrs - Object-Orient Technology
(B) - 3 hrs - College Algebra
(A) - 1 hrs - Practicum: Leadership Training
(A) - 3 hrs - Composition II

Cummulative GPA - 3.84

Dear Friends and Family:

    CompUSA is dead and liquidations are imminent. Thankfully they shouldn't begin until after the holidays at which point I will have money. It is yet to see that they will have anything that is particularly compelling, but I cannot wait nonetheless. I want stuff!
   
    Oh well, back to working on the last bits of homework I'll have for this semester.

// I'm probably not thinking this through enough. NewEgg is more likely to be even cheaper anyway.
// Oh well, no harm in just waiting and finding out.
// ... why the hell am I using the single-line comment tags from Java?

/****
* THAT'S BETTER!
* xO
****/

I really wish I knew how to make highly realistic games. I thought of a great one involving a giant furry space-faring thing with no sun about it.

Good Webcomics/Shorts My Family Should Look Into:
XKCD - http://xkcd.com
Bunny - http://bunny.frozenreality.co.uk/

Sometimes I think that as a child I traded my dreams away. I can't remember whether the procurer was a nightmare or a nymph, but I don't think it matters anyway; I'll never get them back. I wonder what I got for them though. Was it a candy bar or a field of flowers to romp through or some other childish thing? No, I think I traded them for this intense creativity. I traded them that I could have something to help me get through my boring days. I traded them for something that would extend my dreamscape. With such a thing in hand I probably thought I could find eternal happiness. I was wrong, as children are ought to be. Oh well, there have been concessions.

In the same way that many find recluse in dreams, I find recluse in my imagination. Just as a normal person would tumble down the rabbit hole while dreaming, I do so awake. Unlike them, who barely make it to the hatter, I perpetually stroll through white rose mazes. Even so though I am not satisfied. Why would I be? This ebb-and-flow of reality muddles my thoughts and my memories. Do I sit at my desk or on a sunlit lawn? Does it matter? Where was I seven years ago? Answer the question (you aren't allowed to use memories that feel cobbled together). Bah!

Fuck, it's probably just melancholy. Maybe I just really don't want to do put together an annotated bibliography and some warped existentialism is my defense mechanism. Oh well, it's about time I made a wish list.

- I want a more memorable childhood. This isn't something I can blame on my family because I'm sure it was good enough. I mean sure it was fun at times and I look back on that stuff fondly, but I still want more. I want the incandescent bits of time I can look back on with glee. I want the moments that yell their importance from rooftops. I want the rose-colored glasses, the stylish hairdo, and the disturbing appreciation for all that is and is to be. Right now though, I don't and it's really bugging me. Shit.

- I want someone to dictate my imaginings better than I've ever been able to. I want them to echo how the light reflected off the speeding motorbikes and how the sun reflected off the metallic grass. I want to hear the popping of the leaves and see the hundreds of light beams that reflect off of the newly cut grass and right into them. I want to experience the things that I write about and imagine without having to worry about them bouncing off and making a "cliche!" sound. It'd be nice.

- I want... a tangible future. And maybe a tangible past. And maybe a present that didn't feel like a farce.

- I want to be able to describe myself. I want to have a favorite color. I want to have a favorite movie. I want to have a favorite anything that doesn't just seem like something I picked out of a hat. I want to be in an argument that doesn't leave my thinking "it's this way because this is how it is and all this shit isn't really real anyway so you should just agree with me and stop pissing me off because I'm really thinking about beating the shit out of you even though I know that I won't because though what's going on right now doesn't seem that fantastic it's still far more entertaining than jail would be." Okay? Yeah. Awesome.


In other news:

- 2nd place in Lorwyn sealed netting 18 packs.
- I have a dentist appointment in the morning.
- The Red Baron microwavable pizza things I picked up at Sam's are pretty good.
- I have four more twelve inch wheat hoagies left under my bed with enough stuff in my fridge to fill them up.
- The Nightmare Before Christmas soundtrack (well, the second disc) is still nice to listen to.
- I need to ask Katie about a summer internship with someone local.

It's been a month and a day. . .
And I have a feeling that there's something I need to say. . .
And that if I don't get it out now, it's going to stay. . .
And inside me shrivel and decay. . .
And it's just that if I don't say this one thing now. . .
And somehow prevent the pain it will sow. . .
I'll feel like shit because I really don't have the patience to finish this shitty ass rhyme and end with the "gay? psyche!" thing I had thought of as soon as I had looked at the calender and popped the title into this fucking post. I mean shit man, am I that lazy of a motherfucker to where I just give up on something as simple as this? Obviously! Who cares if you aren't sure if definition of the sow you're going for doesn't match up with the pronunciation you want? Fuck it!

Hmm. . . ellipsis, ellipsis, ellipsis, visual record of digital bloodstains from slit wrists. . . it's time for what I had set out for this journal entry to actually be: a short description of what has been going on in my life (very short; to the point of not actually explaining a damn thing) and a proper talking-down to myself about not writing more or at least, no writing what I should be writing enough.

I. A Short Bit About Life In General (In So Far As Mine Is Concerned)

a. I'm in the fourth week of College, majoring in Information Science. Even at this point in my collegiate career (doesn't quite sound right, but it works for this portion of a portion of a post), I'm not exactly sure what my major entails. I know it has to deal with handling data and the purpose of its classes is to properly introduce one to the societal uses and perceptions of data and to nail down how to mess with it, but that doesn't really make me feel that I properly understand it. I know that people can become admins and stuff, but I just don't feel the connection between my major and any possible career I may have. I know that I want to do this, or at least I know that it is the thing I most want to do out of the options available to me (taking over the world was not a major in so far as I know and if you were wondering FUCKING POLITICS DOES NOT COUNT <3), but THAT ISN'T ENOUGH. I WANT A CONNECTION TO MY REALITY GREATER THAN THE ONE THAT I FEEL RIGHT NOW. I WANT TO FEEL THE AIR PASS BETWEEN MY FINGERS LIKE MOLASSES THAT I MAY PRETEND SOME GREATER CONTROL OVER THE COSMOS AND FEEL LIKE I ACTUALLY MEAN SOMETHING IN THE FUCKING LONG RUN!

. . . Okay, that was a tad more introspective than I wanted to get. Oh well, you live and you learn (etc, etc, etc) . . .

b. My room is nice. I'm not sure about the dimensions or any of the possible smells (I haven't been able to identify any of them but the ones in my room are better than the ones outside it), but it's overall nice. We begin at the door behind which I keep my towel (full-size for drying and hand for scrub'n) and to the fore of which is this little thing I keep my books and toiletries and such on. I also have my utensils and such on there. After cleaning my little basket thing (it's pink! -- NOT) it's become obvious that I must separate my Clearasil face shit from the rest because it gets on the bottom and somehow becomes black and even more smelly. Anyway beyond that you hit my fridge which I've managed to fit a bunch of stuff in (well... enough):

1/2 Bag of dinner rolls
1 Jar of Jelly
2 Gallons of Milk (various states of drinkedness)
1 Gallon of Orange Juice
1 Thing of FUCKING DELICIOUS BROWNIES MY GRANDMOTHER MADE (yes, all of that needed to be capitalized)
2 Uneaten crossiants
1 Perpetually frozen bottle of water
1 Package of frozen chicken nugget things
1 Thing of little applesauce serving jiggers

I also keep my magic cards and stuff on that. Oh, and it locks! Beyond that is my monitor/tv that is really nice and I'm glad I have it. It's connected to the power outlet and to my fantastic new computer (which may, depending on how stupid I continue to be with my money (working on it, seriously) will affect my eating) which has 4GB of RAM, a Nvidia Geforce 8800 GTS graphics card, a 2.4GHz or something Pentium Duo processor, three hard drives, an ethernet card (because my motherboard was apparently too advanced to come with one), a power adapter inside (because my power supply was too old to have a 8-pin connector), a bunch of fans (that came with the case), and a single DVD drive (because I was running out of Molex connectors and I wanted fans (who needs a floppy drive anyway? I can just pop it open and pop one in)).

Under my computer is the dresser wherein I keep my white stuff, my shirts and jeans, and my magic cards in that order (up to down). After that there is the desk I keep my printer, my alarm clock, my desk light, and stuff on. I also keep stuff in that, but that's just normal office stuff and isn't that spectacular. Opposite that stuff is a bed that I for some reason find comfortable. It's hard, but I like it that way. Other than that there is a chair I don't use (I got a new one that I have as of yet not mentioned and so there it is) and a closet. I keep snacks in the closet and that's about it. Maybe a box or two too.

c. My roommates are Justin, Zeke, and Roland. Justin works a lot and is rarely apparent. He has a ponytail too and has a bunch of technology-fixing stuff. He also has a Nerf gun that he and Zeke play with (alter, mod, etc.). Zeke is short, annoying, and sleeps like... well like he's a fucking rock. The only thing that wakes him up is a tap of the little hotel bell thing he keeps in his room. Otherwise he's been known to sleep for a good twelve to sixteen hours (to the point of missing two days of classes in the first week and sleeping till 4pm or so last Sunday). Roland is a gangster/player motherfucker who is always in and out with women and such. He's damned annoying and either his friend or his brother is always over here sleeping on the couch. Him I don't mind much.

d. My classes include two ones involving Java (easy), a Composition II course I plan on writing a bunch of essays on Magic: The Gathering in, a thing on Ethics that is like 55 minutes long and just has us reading, a History of Civilization course that gets me up at like 8:40am on Tuesdays and Thursdays, a College Algebra class whose test I should probably study for tomorrow, and a Leadership class that doesn't amount to much of anything. Compared to my brother I don't have any fucking homework and am damned happy about it. It means that the ten hours I have to spend in lab a week (for scholarship) can be taken up playing Half-Life 2 or browsing the internet.

e. I've joined a Magic: The Gathering guild/group thing on campus that meets on alternating Wednesdays (I seriously can only spell this thing by thinking out "Wed-Nes-Days" and it's always been like that) and Fridays. The leader, Heath, is an idiot and I have no problem telling him such to his face. If he says "Steel Rainbow~" one more time I'm going to shove his Cranial Platings down his throat (note: I can beat the deck easily, it's his saying that sort of shit that pisses me off). The sub-leader whose name I can't remember right now is a cool dude who could use some work on his decks. Zeke is the secretary. I'm the treasurer simply because they needed one on the forms. I don't actually do anything. There are a couple more members, but I can't remember most of them. There's Holder and Doug and this one guy who works at Rave.

f. I've beaten Bioshock. It was fun. I saved the girls because I felt it was the right thing to do. I'm not sure if I can bring myself to go back through and harvest them. Not only is it overtly cruel and disturbing in a game I already find rather chilling (damned 40s and 50s music, constantly underwater feelings, and spider splicers), but it also doesn't seem to have any real benefits. I'm not sure how much ADAM you get from killing the girls, but Tenebaum seems to give you plenty to compensate. There was only like two things I hadn't gotten by the end of the game.

Oh and I loved the story. The twists and stuff were great. All that horrible utopian stuff and the pits from Ayn Rand and stuff were great. The parasite, the smuggler, free will, etc. Hell, Andrew Ryan has Ayn Rand in his name! Sweet.

II. Talking To Myself About Writing (and why I should do it)

a. Write you son-of-a-bitch! Why? Because I told you to! You have all those images in your head and you know you can't draw so the only way you can get them out is to put fingers to keyboard or pen to paper and just jot left and right, or right to left if you feel up to it! Get the ideas and let them flow.

b. Same. Write!

c. Don't do poetry. You suck at poetry.


SUPER IMPORTANT UPDATE:

DON'T FORGET THAT INTERNATIONAL "TALK LIKE A PIRATE" DAY IS WEDNESDAY SEPTEMBER 19TH!

I will this day be moving into my dorm-room thingy. That's about it.

EDIT:

In. Is nice.

Most of crap is ready for college. All I really need to do is figure out what I'll need for my dorm room, which I probably won't know until I actually get there to check it out. I already know where my money is coming from (scholarship) and when it is going to get into my bank account (sometime in August) at which point I'll be having to use whatever extra I get (that isn't used for tuition or housing) on books. If any is left I'll probably couple it with whatever I have after my next splurge to probably upgrade some component of a computer. I'll probably be at memory at that point.

Anyway: (kind-of recent news)

- Chicago was good. It wasn't that windy, though it was slightly. I loved the mass transportation system. Know why? It was rather simple to use, went to the places I wanted to go to, and well, given my dislike of driving, I would love for one to be in this town. n Went to Cheesecake Factory. Hancock Tower (?). The Other Tower (?). To play pool at Lucky Strike.

- I've been taking a summer course to get used to class-like stuff before beginning the Fall Semester properly. It's a simple thing covering Visual Basic and I haven't had a problem with it yet.

- I've also been temporarily working at ark.gov while one of my mother's co-workers are disabled (pregnant; mental and physical). The job is easy and I get money for it. Win-WIn.

- I sent my laptop in for a new monitor because it was on the fritz. I have fragged my desktop's hard drive and installed Ubuntu Linux on it (7.04 - Fiesty). It was done with a minimum of hassle and is what I am using OS-wise to write this post n' such. Booyah. The only problem I'm having doesn't really deal with the OS. I want a better graphics card so I get to a higher resolution.

- Edgefest was good though I had to stand in line for two hours to get in. There was much beer, smoking, and line-standing. Sevendust, Puddle of Mudd, Godsmack, and other people played. I liked Godsmack best though they pissed me off by only playing a very small portion of Black Sabbath's "War Pigs". It was also pretty much the only thing I did on my birthday (presents consisted of cash-monies [sic]).

- Got and beat Sacred (including Underworld bit). Got Neverwinter Nights 2 and have started to play that. The character I play with looks like Lilith (and is actually named that and some other last name I can't remember) and is a Warlock. Lawful Evil bitches.

- Got some sort of a bank account.

=> I'll be gone from this Saturday (6/15) to next Thursday or so (6/20) on a trip to Chicago. I have no idea what will happen but that I know I will never want to ride in a car again by the time I get back. I may go see a play or something.

Past
Graduated High School

Present
Guitar Hero II, which I honestly think I got just to listen to "Carry on Wayward Son".
- The slight wrist ache caused by a little too much riffing.
-- The slight knee ache caused by too much standing (note to self: get new knees (bionic)).

Future
Jump a Level to 18 (June 8th) (note: haxxored skill quotient for lower level)
Go to Edgefest
Go to Chicago (family vacation in late June)

--
Note to People Who Could Be in the Know:

Xth Edition is looking niceish. Arcanis and all.

Note to people:
-  I had my prom today. I looked sexy (note: as I always do). I had a reasonable time.
-  I will be sleeping in late (note: as I always do) tomorrow. 
-  I will NOT be attending any High School classes ever again. I will NOT miss them.

This is the Not-Run-Through-Word-Grammar-Thingy version of a pre-natal Autobiography thing for Creative Writing. Would you count it as upbeat and just as the teacher asked? I would. Anyway, look in the lj-cut. No mention of the medical terms or description included. That shit is nasty. Chapter 1: The Nothingness Before Me What is darker than the primordial darkness of the womb? What is darker than that horrible nothingness that makes boogie-men wet themselves? What other thing makes children die in their sleep when they are young and healthy, simply because they dream up a vision of it? Nothing. Such is the horrible nature of conception, of a beginning. And yet, suspended thus in the birthing area, the child seemed as apathetic as could be; he seemed neither comforted or discomforted by his surroundings no matter how they would horrify one who had actually formed a brain. As so far as the child knew, nothing existed, not even he. There was nothing going on not even the most simplest, most bestial urge passed through him. All there was was the random firing of nerves that caused him to kick or elbow in whichever direction, into his brother or otherwise. All that happened was beyond him for he was yet to be born. He could not even survive on his own yet and needed an umbilical cord. Yet even still, he was important, as evidenced by the great amount of talk that went on about him. Though he could not understand their words, his family and most of all his parents, spoke of how he came to be and how happy they were to have him. They spoke of a fateful night in a new house on Markham street where the two had given up remodeling for intimate contact. They cursed birth pills and how they acted as fertility enhancers when taken in numbering more than one. They all gasped in surprise at the prospect of twins and yet the more masculine of the voices did so more than the rest, worried about the taxing financial states. They conversed openly about the conditions of the babies and their possible fates as brain damaged individuals. They knew not of what would happen and how true it would be, the disturbance in their children, and yet still they spoke of more and more. As the days continued into months, and the fetuses grew arms, legs, and joyous middle fingers, the nearest voice to the two children, which was both maternal and grouchy, spoke incessantly of a need for peanut butter. It was the mother's balm for the pains of pregnancy and thus she ate many, many jars of the brand called Jif. Yet, during the same time, she found her poison in the smell of cooked ground beef. Overwhelmed by such a smell, it would cause her stomach to turn and thus too the babies, which for its part probably caused some of their later mental problems. Only after eight months did something change, and drastically did it. Suddenly the child, who was far more advanced than his brother, heard a couple incomprehensible cries about high-blood pressure and could feel the soft echo of a needle being driven into his mother's arm. Apparently, though many felt it was slightly premature, he and his brother were going to be leaving the darkness of the womb for much brighter places. Thus, the mother was made to give birth a month before babies were normally due. The first thing the child noticed was the sudden lack of liquid about him. Next, he could feel the quakes begin as his mother's body began to reject him. Not surprised by the sudden change of pace, even in his intellectual infancy, he went along with the act, crying to keep up appearances. Next, he could suddenly feel the absence of his brother, which was very comforting for him. The wretch was gone and he had his own primordial, rather horrifying in hindsight, cesspool in which to dwell. It was great, at least until he too started to go. At first, the going was okay, until he turned sideways. Though he didn't really mean to, it still took some prodding and fussing to get him out. Thirty minutes later, as he burst out into the world with a wail, he was astounded by what he saw. Instead of a dank nothingness, there were bright things and shiny things and sharp things. He had loved the ooze and the horror, sure, but this was so much better. The new place, even though he didn't know what to call them at that point, had knives. They were shiny and sleek and judging by how easily that cord was cut, very sharp. It was great! He wanted more! Oh, and he would get it. His birth was only the first step in a life-long journey of personal satisfaction.

Update after first day: - New rules are more attune to them actually enforcing the old rules. - Seven-day schedule is going to get incredibly tiring incredibly fast. - Most classes are at least mildly interesting. - It really needs to stop being the fucking summer already. - Class review: 1 - Creative Writing I - Lots of women in class (annoying ones), cynical teacher (the annoying, non-charismatic kind), but otherwise I don't know much. The teacher seems to overemphasize women's difficulties which is strange, especially with her being one. 2 - Biology - Young teacher and should be entertaining, albeit simply. 3 - AP Government - I <3 Coach Cothren. She's patriotic, blonde (in the funny, slightly demeaning, but not over annoying way), and has a certain vitality. Her body is a mess though with multiple growths and another messed up spinal disc (or some disc anyway) and thus she'll be out for the first two weeks of school. She really needs to start listening to her doctors. 4 - Computer Diagnostics - Bahloul, but tolerable Bahloul. Ever seen Herbig from Dead Like Me? Thinking that kind of personality. We should be able to deal with her easily enough. 5 - AP European History - Bland with big books. Hot as hell because it's in a portable. 6 - Health - Energetic teacher. Should be as simple as last time. 7 - AP English/Literature - We take up almost all the chairs (maybe 1 or 2 left). The teacher, Scott, has one of those weird personalities many english teachers have. Should be some good books to read. When asked, "Why is the sky blue?" the teacher responded, "Well it's not blue all the time." It is as it should be.

Lesse... this year's schedule is... apparently 7 classes a day. They include:

1 - Creative Writing I
2 - Biology (Yay for not taking it earlier)
3 - AP Government
4 - Computer Diagnostics
5 - AP European History
6 - Consumer Science (1/2 cred) / Health (1/2 cred)
7 - AP English/Literature

Apparenlty our principal this year doesn't want anyone to be able to change their schedule unless there is something horrifically wrong with it. Fucking administration. Oh well, at least it's my last year.

Note: Sleeping with your head face down on a pillow, drooling, is a good reason for your face to be numb and to have problems breathing throughout a dream. It's also a good way to get a crick in your neck when you wake up. It's not advised. What was cool about the dream was I got to fly (a lot and some people kept dragging me back down but I finally figured out how to accelerate in the end) and I saw this weird chocobo walkthrough book or something. I had like this whole double-locker thing full of PC games (or at least like boxes) with tons of guides stacked next to it. There was some bubble wrap in the back I think. That is all.

The drugs fucked me up for a bit. As soon as they put on the laughing gas my whole body became tingly and I began fucking around with the feeling. First I moved my right index finger round in a movement similar to the old windows waiting icon. I even felt it because of the pulse thing on my finger. Next I started to hear weird tones whenever I did something. There was this high-pitched one when my mouth was close and a deeper one when it was open. There was even thing phone-like tone coming randomly from the doctor. Eventually I just held my mouh open because it sounded cool with the monotone sound combining with the odd tone from the doctor. After a couple minutes, or seconds at least, of that I was driven back to reality when the doctor gave me the needles. I then drifted back to sleep and woke up some hours later in the hallway of the place incredibly dazed, nauseous, and with my mouth filled with blood-drenched gauze. After we haphazardly got to the car we headed back home. For about thirty minutes we were forced to wait in that car as they filled our prescription (painkillers, antibiotics, and ibuprofen). Later we got home and I promptly went upstairs and hurled blood into the toilet. I then took the medication and went to sleep for a couple hours. That's how it's been since Thursday, except with increasingly more solid food. Other Things That Have Happened: - I have completed all 6 decks from the cards I got (one for White, Blue, Black, Red, Green, and Artifacts respectively).
No more eating or drinking for I am getting my wisdom teeth out tomorrow morning. I wonder what shit I'll do while under.

"I feel pretty, Oh, so pretty, I feel pretty and witty and bright!" News Involving Dramen: - I ordered 776 cards for $60. I plan on making a profit off them. - I got a consultation on having my wisdom teeth removed. It happens Thursday (27-7-06). I will be drugged via my veins. - I haven't been able to sleep lately, lots of pre-dreaming dreaming. Damn twilight and its ability to make me think random thoughts and live through various scenarios. Hopefully this will pass and I'll be able to pass easily into unconciousness. - I have decided to go to sleep in five minutes. (1:49am)

Okay I just got back from Edgefest (4PM to about 11PM) and went like so:

- I arrived and got in a very large line to get it in. Amazingly, even given the size, it went very quickly and we were soon inside, basking in the sun and taking in the noxious vapors of the smokers.
- I instantly got a corndog and coke (7$ total) and sat upon the hill from where I watched the first three bands (if memory serves they were Trapt, Evans Blue, and Halestorm). I wasn't feeling it at all so I took to massacring the can and drawing on index cards with a sharpy and highlighter. During this time I hailed Jesse and Jeremy, spoke to them, and let them continue on about their way.
- About halfway through Shinedown I decided to see what all this 'against the stage' thing was all about. About 400ft away (I have no idea but later some guy said that) from the stage I watched, even getting enthusiastic about the end. 
- Between Shinedown and Anthrax a woman with a mohawk rose through the main bit of crowd and repeatedly showed her breasts (I'd say 8/10, but I've never been a good judge of anything), I think she was arrested. Also arrested were two rednecks who decided to fight. From the concert promoters who took the stage I learned that there had also apparently been an overdose (unkown on what but there were a number of drunkards). Through Anthrax I just sat. Their heavier sound wasn't to my liking and my back was starting to hurt. At some point a heavily disturbed (possibly drunk) woman hobbled over with some help and slumped to floor. Some prodding from people I would call her friends got her to drunken stumble somewhere most likely safe. I didn't really care.
- Now then the main spectacle was Rob Zombie. He was loud, charismatic, and I actually got into him. I did the whole head-banging thing, devil's horn sign, chanted with the crowd, and even jumped for a short time (I rarely jump, this was amazing). The guitar was really good and the crowd was goaded multiple times. They got the old Iron Head guy on stage through a song or two. As far as I can remember they finished off with Dragula (which everyone, yours truly included, had been chanting for for awhile) and Lords of Salem (they called it musical masturbation; they just had enjoy themselves). All in all I learned that no matter their individual voices a 1000+ people always sound harmonious together, especially during "House of a 1000 Corpses", "Devil's Rejects", and "Dragula."

That is all. I'm going to go sleep, wake up, and got the Coldsnap prerelease. Should be fun.
